item.title: Chera Dynasty and Kerala
item.description: The Chera Dynasty and Kerala മലയാളത്തില്‍ വായിക്കാം The Cheras were the most prominent dynasty of Kerala who were one of the mūvēntar (the three crowned rulers). This Empire was referred as Kedalaputo in the Emperor Ashoka’s Pali edicts. Not just the mighty Ashoka Empire, but the Greeks and Romans marked the existence of this stupendous empire of Kerala. With their Naval might, the Cheras conquered the Sea, and regimented maritime trade in the region.

item.title: Arabi Malayalam
item.description: Arabi Malayalam മലയാളത്തില്‍ വായിക്കാം Arabi-Malayalam is a macaronic language popular among the Muslim community of Kerala, which served an import role in the spread of Islamic knowledge in Malabar. The area from Ponnani to Kasargod was the major influence zone of Arabi Malayalam. Although some sources conclude that the Arabs had trade links with Kerala even before Islam, the birth of this macaronic language and its vast literature is credited to the teachings of Islam.
